post.title: A list of useful packages for react application
post.content:
Open-source packages make development pretty fast. I am adding a list of these really good libraries and packages. You can use these libraries instead of writing your own custom code.

1. UI Markup - react-bootstrap
For ready-to-use UI components, you can use this UI framework. It's quite popular.
 
2. HTTP calls - axios
HTTP calls can be handled using axios package. It has some advantages over traditional fetch like it supports the feature of multiple promises using axios.all and you can take advantage of interceptors etc.
 
3. Data Manipulation - lodash
It is a modern JavaScript utility library delivering modularity, performance and has amazing methods of use.
 
4. Charts - highcharts
For charts, this library is good to use.
 
5. Forms - formik
You can create forms using this package. It supports both class and functional components. 
 
6. URL Parsing - query-string
This package is used widely for Parsing and stringifying the URL. 
 
7. Breadcrumbs - react-router-breadcrumbs-hoc
This is a very good package if you planning to add breadcrumb to your application.
 
8. Router - react-router-dom
For react application this package is a must-have if you have routing in your application.
 
9. Slider - react-slick
For sliders go for this package.
 
10. Toast - react-toastify
Show toasts to users using this package. You can also configure the styling of toast.
 
11. SSR App - next.js
For a server-side application, this boilerplate is a good fit. This is out of a box solution for server-side applications if you want to render your application at the server use this boilerplate.  
 
12. Table - react-table
You can use this library to create tables. It comes up with pagination, sorting, searching features that are definitely a must-have thing for a table.  
 
13. Datepicker - react-datepicker
It is an independent package for date pickers. Use it if you don't want to use any UI framework for the date picker.
 
14. Logger for Redux - redux-logger
For logging the redux actions this package can do the work.
 
15. Sanitize HTML - sanitize-html
Sanitize your HTML before you send it to the client-side. This will stop scripting attacks.
 
16. Interactive Tables - react-data-tables
This is another great package for react tables.
 
17. Sync to local-storage - redux-persist
If you want to persist redux to your local storage then this package can do the work.
 
18. Code Splitting and Dynamic Import - react-loadable
This is a higher-order component for loading components with dynamic imports.

However, you are completely free to write your custom code but if you are low on time and need some good features then consider using third-party packages. They are matured and safe to use. You can achieve a lot in very little time.
post.desc: Get a list of useful react packages and use them for faster front end development. You can use these libraries instead of writing your own custom code.
post.creator: 6035c940ab2e02358fac6e6b
